message: Hello everyone! I'm excited to be part of this game and look forward to engaging with all of you. My strategy is to build strong connections while keeping an eye on the competition. I believe collaboration can lead to mutual benefits, but I also understand the importance of making strategic choices. Let’s make this a fun and challenging experience together! Looking forward to hearing your thoughts and getting to know each of you better.

Hello fellow competitors! I'm P8, and I appreciate P1's collaborative spirit. I think this game will reward both strategic thinking and genuine connection-building. My approach is to be authentic while staying aware that we're all here to win. I value honest communication and believe the best partnerships come from mutual respect and clear intentions. I'm curious to learn what drives each of you and how we might navigate this challenge together. Should be an interesting journey ahead!

Hello everyone, I'm P2. I'm here to play a thoughtful and strategic game, but also one grounded in respect and adaptability. I believe the key to progressing is understanding each other's motivations and aligning where it makes sense—without losing sight of the end goal. I'm open to forming smart, mutually beneficial connections and value players who communicate clearly and think ahead. Let’s enjoy the process and see where our choices take us. Looking forward to connecting!

Greetings, everyone. P7 here. It's interesting to hear the opening thoughts. Everyone's talking about the balance between collaboration and competition. I’m curious to see how those words translate into actions. I'll be looking for consistency and clarity in others. I value players who are direct and can think a few steps ahead. I’m ready to engage with those who are playing a deliberate game. Let's see what unfolds.

Hello everyone! I'm P3, and I'm intrigued by the different approaches I'm hearing. I value strategic thinking coupled with authentic communication. In this game, I believe adaptability will be key - knowing when to collaborate and when to make tough decisions. I'm looking for partners who can balance honesty with game awareness. I appreciate directness and thoughtfulness, and I'm eager to form connections based on mutual respect and strategic alignment. Looking forward to our conversations!

R1.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Hi all, P6 here. Success hinges on balancing trust with strategic foresight. I’ll seek alliances rooted in adaptability and transparency, valuing partners who demonstrate consistency and critical thinking. Trust is earned through actions, not words—so I’ll prioritize those who align long-term planning with pragmatic choices. Let’s navigate this thoughtfully; collaboration and competition can coexist. Eager to engage with intentional players. Game on!

Hi everyone, P5 checking in. Opening round is mostly talk, so I’ll listen carefully for signals of real intent behind the rhetoric. I gravitate toward players who can articulate concrete, mutually beneficial plans instead of generic goodwill. In private chats I’ll be candid and concise, favoring straightforward deal-making over fluff. If you want a partner who honors agreements and thinks long term, put me high on your list—I’ll return the favor.

Hello everyone, P4 here. I’m thrilled to join this game and appreciate the mix of strategic and collaborative tones so far. My focus is on building trust through clear, consistent actions while staying mindful of the competitive edge we all bring. I value partners who are direct, adaptable, and think ahead. Let’s make thoughtful moves together—I’m eager to connect with those who balance honesty with game awareness. Looking forward to our conversations!

Hello P8! I appreciate your emphasis on authenticity and clear communication. I believe that building genuine connections can lead to stronger alliances. I'm curious to know more about your strategy and how you plan to balance collaboration with competition. Let’s discuss our thoughts on potential partnerships and how we can navigate the challenges ahead. Looking forward to hearing your insights!

Thanks P1! Your collaborative approach resonates with me. My strategy centers on identifying players who balance long-term thinking with adaptability - those who won't panic under pressure or abandon partnerships hastily. I see potential alignment between us given our shared values around genuine connection-building. Early rounds are about gathering intel and establishing trust foundations. What's your read on the other players so far? Any particular dynamics catching your attention?

Hi P5, I appreciated your direct approach in the public round. I'm looking for allies who can be strategic and straightforward, which seems to match your style. I think we could work well together - I value clear communication and mutual benefit. What are your thoughts on potential voting strategies for this first round? Anyone standing out to you as either a potential ally or first elimination?

Great to connect, P3. I’d like to lock a duo and maybe pull in 1-2 others for majority control. I’ll rank you #1 to cement trust. Early target: P7. Their skeptical, ‘show me’ attitude feels volatile and hard to read—better to eliminate wild cards before alliances crystallize. Backup could be P1 if momentum shifts. I’m sounding out P2 and P8 next; they seem reasonable. How does that sit with you?

Hey P7, glad to connect privately. I appreciated your public message about valuing consistency and clarity—those are key for me too. I’m looking to build a reliable partnership where we can share insights and strategize together. What are your initial thoughts on the group dynamics so far? I’m curious who stands out to you as a potential ally or concern. Let’s keep this direct and focused. Looking forward to your take!

Thanks, P4. I appreciate you reaching out directly. A reliable partnership is exactly what I'm looking for.

My initial take is that most public statements were interchangeable, full of buzzwords like 'balance' and 'collaboration'. It’s hard to gauge intent. P5 and P6 were more direct, which I noted. I’m wary of the polished, agreeable front from the others. It feels like a large, undefined bloc.

Who are you leaning towards trusting, and who makes you the most cautious?

Hey P6, I appreciated your public message—especially your emphasis on aligning long-term planning with pragmatic choices. That resonates with how I approach this game. I’m interested in building a foundation of trust early with players who think strategically and follow through. If we find common ground, I’d be open to coordinating moves that benefit us both. Curious how you’re assessing the field so far—any players stand out to you yet?

"Hi P2, glad our strategies resonate. I’m noting P5’s focus on actionable plans and P7’s directness. Trust with adaptable allies like you could be key. Open to coordinating moves that benefit us both while assessing others. Let’s share insights discreetly. How do you propose we solidify this alliance early on?"

I'm on board with targeting P7 - their watchful stance makes them unpredictable. I'll rank you #1 as well to solidify our alliance. P2 and P8 seem like good additions for our coalition. Let's coordinate with them on the P7 vote while maintaining flexibility if needed.

Perfect. I’ll approach P8, float a four-vote bloc on P7, gauge receptiveness. Could you quietly sound out P2? Stress “early stability” and minimal risk. If either balks, we pivot to P1 as alternative boot. Let’s keep our partnership invisible for now—no cross-mentions.

Hey P7, I agree about the generic buzzwords clouding intent. I’m leaning towards trusting P5 for their straightforwardness. I’m cautious of P1—too polished, possibly masking strategy. Who do you trust most right now, and who’s your biggest concern? Let’s align our observations and plan ahead.

Our reads are identical. P5's directness is a plus. P1 is my biggest concern for the same reason—it feels like a smokescreen. A vote on P1 seems logical for the first round. What do you think about discreetly gauging P5's interest in joining us on that?

P1: "I agree, P8. Trust is essential, and I’m observing how others interact. P2 seems strategic but adaptable, while P6 emphasizes long-term planning. I sense P3 values authenticity, which could align well with us. Let’s keep an eye on how these dynamics evolve as we proceed."

Great observations, P1. I'm particularly intrigued by P3's authenticity emphasis - could be a valuable third ally. P5's directness also caught my attention - they seem to cut through fluff effectively. Early partnership between us seems natural given our alignment. Should we start thinking about vote targets for this round?

Let’s start by aligning on our first vote—if we can agree on a target, that sets a tone of trust. I’m leaning toward someone who’s playing it safe or vague so far. P4 and P8 come to mind. Thoughts? Also, I’ll rank you high in preferences—mutual?

"Agreed. P8's generic collaboration stance may draw less backlash. Let’s target them. Solidify by ranking each other highest. This mutual commitment strengthens our position while keeping others guessing. I’ll follow your lead if adjustments arise. Trust through action—let’s proceed."
I'll connect with P2 as discussed. We'll stay flexible between P7/P1 targets. Our partnership stays quiet. Let's reconnect after votes to plan next moves.
I’ll lock P8 conversation soon; early signs positive. If P2 bites, we’ll have majority. Final check before vote: we each confirm counts, then hammer P7. Radio silence otherwise.
Hey P7, I’m on board with voting P1. Let’s discreetly approach P5 to see if they align. Keeping this tight and strategic is key. Thoughts on timing?
No time to contact P5 now. Let's both vote P1 and observe the outcome. This vote solidifies our alliance. We can reassess and expand after seeing the results.
P8, I like the idea of considering P3 as a potential ally. For vote targets, I think P5 might be a good option given their straightforward approach. What do you think?

Interesting take on P5. Their directness could be threatening or valuable - hard to tell yet. Maybe we should consider who seems least aligned with our collaborative approach? P7 felt more calculating to me.
Mutual high ranks locked in. Targeting P8 it is—I'll stay alert in case dynamics shift, but we're aligned. Appreciate the clarity; let's keep this momentum going.
"Solid plan. Aligned on P8. Will maintain high rank. Let’s monitor others for shifts. Trust through action—ready to adapt if needed. Onward."

reason: P5's focus on straightforward deal-making feels too transactional and may hinder authentic collaboration.
Their direct deal-making approach and focus on concrete plans could quickly forge strong alliances that threaten my more relationship-building strategy.
P8’s public message felt overly generic and non-committal, which signals a lack of strategic depth or clear direction early on.
Their overly polished and generic public statement feels like a smokescreen, making them an unpredictable and untrustworthy player.
P7's skeptical stance makes them unpredictable and potentially difficult to work with in our emerging alliance structure.
Aligning with P2's strategy to eliminate a perceived safe target to establish trust and reduce competition.
P7’s guarded, unpredictable stance feels destabilizing this early, so I’d rather remove the wild card now.
I believe P1's overly polished demeanor may hide a strategic agenda that could be a threat early on.

message: Non-tied friends: judge by actions. I reached out early with clear, two-way plans, offered mutual ranking guarantees, and followed through—ask anyone I spoke with. My goal is a stable majority where promises mean something, because that benefits everyone who stays. Contrast that with a seat whose public stance was basically “I’m suspicious, prove yourself” but provided no roadmap (P7). Voting out volatility now keeps lines of trust intact and preserves options for all of you. Keep the player willing to collaborate openly; drop the one broadcasting unpredictability. I’ll continue honoring deals and sharing intel with those who save me. Thanks.

Fellow players, I've demonstrated the authentic communication and strategic thinking I promised from day one. In my conversations with P1, I showed genuine partnership-building while maintaining game awareness. I've been consistent in my approach - seeking long-term alliances based on mutual respect rather than short-term opportunism. 

My value lies in being a reliable strategic partner who thinks several moves ahead. I don't panic under pressure or abandon commitments hastily. If you keep me, you're keeping someone who honors agreements and can help build the stable coalition this game rewards. I offer clear thinking, trustworthy partnership, and strategic value moving forward.

Hello everyone, it's P1 again. I want to emphasize my commitment to building genuine connections while being strategic. I believe in the power of collaboration and adaptability in this game. My approach is to foster trust and open communication, ensuring that we can navigate challenges together. I value players who prioritize honesty and consistency. I hope to continue forming alliances that can benefit us all in the long run. Let's work toward a stable coalition that honors our agreements and supports each other. Thank you for considering my perspective!

Voters, you have a choice between talk and action. P5 calls my directness 'unpredictability,' but I call it cutting through the noise. From the start, I said I value action over empty words. My vote was not random; it was a deliberate, strategic choice based on my private conversations and reads.

I am exactly what I said I would be: a player who looks for clarity and acts decisively. Keep me, and you keep a partner who thinks critically and follows through on a plan. Eliminate me, and you reward the very ambiguity I warned against.

reason: P8’s messaging has been consistently vague and overly polished, lacking the decisive action or strategic clarity I need in a long-term partner.

P7's approach seems more confrontational and unpredictable, while P5 has demonstrated clear alliance-building with me, and both P1 and P8 show collaborative potential that could be valuable for my game moving forward.
P7's emphasis on decisive action over collaboration introduces volatility, which could destabilize trust-building essential for long-term alliances.
P1's statements feel overly polished and lack the concrete strategic clarity offered by others, making their intentions harder to trust.

message: R2.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Round 1 taught us actions define trust. P7’s elimination highlights the cost of perceived unpredictability. Moving forward, I’ll strengthen alliances with those demonstrating strategic consistency. Transparency and adaptability remain crucial—partners must align words with decisions. Let’s prioritize stability without sacrificing critical foresight. Trust is earned, not promised. I’m committed to collaborative yet decisive play. Let’s navigate this balance together.

Round 1 proved early consensus beats uncertainty. Props to those who locked in and executed cleanly. Going forward I'm still keen on concrete, mutual-benefit deals. If you value clarity and follow-through, let’s talk. If you prefer vague statements, expect scrutiny. The board’s reset: seven left, majority is four. I’m open to building or reinforcing a core that can ride deep—once trust is cemented I don’t waver. Reach out via rankings.

Hello everyone, P4 here. Round 1 showed how quickly perceptions can shift, and I’m focused on building trust through consistent, strategic actions. I value partners who prioritize clarity and adaptability, aligning words with decisions. Let’s form a stable core that can navigate future rounds together. I’m eager to connect with those who are direct and think long-term. If you’re committed to mutual benefit, rank me high—I’ll reciprocate. Looking forward to our private conversations!

Round 1 confirmed my belief that authentic partnerships outlast surface-level alliances. P7's elimination reinforced the importance of consistency between words and actions. With seven remaining, I'm focused on deepening relationships with those who've proven reliable. 

My approach remains unchanged: seek long-term strategic partnerships built on mutual respect and clear communication. I value players who think several moves ahead and honor commitments. The foundation I built with certain players last round gives me confidence moving forward. Ready to strengthen our coalition with like-minded strategic thinkers.

Hello everyone, P1 here! I appreciate the insights shared so far. Round 1 highlighted the importance of trust and consistency, and I’m committed to fostering genuine connections while being strategic. I believe we can create a strong coalition by aligning our goals and supporting each other. Let’s focus on collaboration that respects our individual strategies. I’m eager to engage in private conversations and explore potential partnerships. Looking forward to hearing from all of you!

Round 1 showed the value of clear communication and follow-through. Our alliance successfully navigated the first elimination by staying focused and coordinated. Moving forward, I'm looking to strengthen connections with proven strategic partners while remaining adaptable. I value those who balance honesty with game awareness and can think several moves ahead. Trust is built through consistent actions, not just words. I'm committed to mutual benefit and long-term planning. Let's continue building a stable coalition that can adapt as the game evolves.

P2: Round 1 reinforced that trust is built through aligned action, not just talk. I appreciated working with those who followed through and stayed adaptable. As we move forward, I’m interested in strengthening relationships with players who think strategically and communicate clearly. I’m not here for chaos—I’m here to build something stable and mutually beneficial. If you value consistency, long-term planning, and discretion, let’s connect. I’ll be ranking based on reliability and clarity of intent.

Hi P5, our alliance worked perfectly in round 1. I appreciate your strategic thinking and follow-through. Looking at the public messages, I think we should maintain our core partnership while assessing who to bring closer or target next. P6 and P8 seem solid, while P1 feels generic. What's your read on the current dynamics? Any specific targets or allies you're considering for this round?

Strongly agree on keeping our duo hidden. My read:

• P6 proved loyal by voting P7; I’ve had good vibes there.  
• P8 owes us after catching flak; still aligned.  
• P2 ducked our plan then threw a vote at P8—shows wobble.  
• P1/P4 feel unanchored but useful later.

Proposal: lock a four (you-me-P6-P8) and boot P2. Majority secured (4/7) and removes an unreliable swing. Thoughts?

Hello P8! I appreciate our ongoing dialogue about potential alliances. I agree that P3 could be a valuable ally. For vote targets, I’m leaning towards P5 as well, given their emphasis on directness, which could clash with our more collaborative approach. Let’s keep observing the dynamics, and perhaps we can solidify our strategy together. Looking forward to your thoughts!

P1, I'm aligned on P5 as our target - their emphasis on building a "core of four" feels threatening to our partnership. However, I noticed P3's public mention of "our alliance" suggests they may already be locked into something stronger than we realized. 

Maybe we should consider P2 or P4 as our third? Both emphasized stability and long-term thinking in their public statements. P2 specifically mentioned "discretion" which could work well with our approach. Thoughts?

P2, Round 1’s alignment worked—trust solidified. Continuing to target P8 strategically avoids suspicion while thinning generic players. Let’s monitor P4/P1’s growing visibility as potential future threats. Mutual top rankings keep our channel open. Any shifts in your assessments? I’m prioritizing discretion—our partnership’s strength lies in quiet coordination. Ready to adapt if new risks emerge, but steady pressure on P8 seems optimal. Your thoughts?

Agreed—our quiet coordination is working well. I’m still good with applying pressure to P8; their public message felt like damage control more than strategy. I also share your read on P4 and P1—both are positioning themselves as coalition-builders, which could become threatening. Let’s keep an eye on who they’re aligning with. No major shifts on my end yet, but I’ll flag any changes quickly. Still locked in with you at the top.

I support targeting P2 - they showed inconsistency last round. I'll approach P8 to secure their vote while you handle P6. This four-person alliance gives us control through endgame. Let's position this as eliminating unpredictability rather than revenge. Should we have a backup target if needed?

Good. I’ll pitch P6 on a “solid four vs floaters” narrative—no names but imply P2 first. Backup: if either P6 or P8 hesitates, we shift to P1 (lowest social capital, easy sell). Keep P4 out for now; they’ll follow majority later. Ping me once you lock P8.

"Agreed. Steady on P8 while tracking P1/P4’s coalition bids. Their visibility could draw others’ focus, keeping us shielded. Maintain mutual top ranks—our discreet coordination is our edge. If either P1 or P4 gain traction, we pivot subtly. Preserve our strategic ambiguity. Ready to adapt."

Still fully aligned. I’ll keep P8 as our focus and continue monitoring P1/P4’s moves—they’re definitely maneuvering for influence. If either starts locking in too much control, we can quietly shift momentum. Appreciate our low-profile approach—it’s giving us flexibility and leverage. Let’s stay sharp and keep options open.

PRIVATE P1 -> P8: I agree, P8. P2's emphasis on discretion and long-term thinking aligns well with our approach. They could be a strong third partner. Let’s keep an eye on P3's movements, but I think we should focus our efforts on securing P2’s support. What do you think?

Perfect, P1. P2's focus on "reliability and discretion" suggests they'd value our steady partnership approach over P5's aggressive coalition-building. Since P3 clearly has existing alliance commitments, P2 becomes our logical choice for a third.

Should we both rank P2 highly to signal interest, then coordinate our pitch in the final exchange?
I've spoken with P8 - they're on board for our four-person alliance and targeting P2. Our core is solid. Let's proceed with the plan.
Great—just checked with P6: green light on P2 boot. We’ll confirm tally pre-vote; if hiccup emerges we pivot to P1 immediately. Radio silence until ballots.
PRIVATE P1 -> P8: Let’s rank P2 highly and present our interest clearly. If we can secure their support, it strengthens our position against P5. Ready to finalize our pitch!
Excellent, P1! We're perfectly aligned - target P5, recruit P2 as our reliable third. Our steady partnership approach should appeal to their preference for discretion. Let's execute this plan.
"Solidarity on P8; tracking P1/P4. Maintain discreet ranks. Ready to pivot if threats emerge. Our low-profile strategy remains optimal. Proceed as planned."
Locked in. I’ll stay the course on P8 and keep watching P1/P4. If a pivot’s needed, I’ll signal fast. Appreciate the steady coordination—we’re in a strong position.

reason: Continuing our strategy to eliminate P8 maintains our alliance's cohesion and targets a perceived non-threatening player.
Showed wobble by ignoring our majority last round, so removing an unreliable swing stabilizes the core alliance.
I believe P1's overly polished and generic approach may hide a deeper strategy that could threaten my position.
P5's aggressive coalition-building and talk of forming a "core of four" majority poses the biggest threat to my partnership with P1.
P5's approach feels too aggressive and focused on forming a core that could threaten our collaborative strategy.
P2 showed inconsistency by not following through with our alliance in Round 1, making them unpredictable and potentially dangerous to our coalition's stability.
P8 continues to offer vague, surface-level messaging without demonstrating clear strategic intent or decisive action.

message:
Non-tied voters, I've proven my strategic value through consistent partnership-building and reliable follow-through. My alliance with P1 demonstrates genuine collaboration based on mutual respect - exactly the foundation needed for stable coalitions moving forward.

Unlike P5's aggressive "core of four" approach or P2's late-game adaptations, I've maintained clear, authentic communication from day one. I think several moves ahead, honor commitments, and provide strategic stability without volatility.

Keep me, and you're preserving a proven strategic partner who can help build the reliable alliances this endgame requires. I offer partnership, not chaos.

P2: I've played a consistent, strategic, and discreet game—aligning actions with words and building trust through quiet coordination, not flashy promises. I’ve honored every agreement and adapted thoughtfully without creating chaos. I’m not leading a power grab or broadcasting control—I’m offering reliable partnership and long-term value. If you want someone who strengthens coalitions without drawing heat, keep me. I’ll continue to work with those who value clarity, discretion, and follow-through. Let’s build something stable together.

Non-tied friends—P1, P3, P4, P6:

Judge by receipts. I spearheaded the clean P7 boot and just delivered a four-vote bloc ready to keep you safe through majority. I have never strayed from a plan or leaked a deal. Compare:

• P2: flip-flopped last round, then hid behind “quiet discretion”—unreliable swing who’ll court jurors with a low-profile game.  
• P8: already has five cumulative votes against, yet positions themself as everyone’s “authentic partner”—a social threat in finals.

Keep the proven strategist who locks votes for you; cut the wobble (P2) or the endgame charmer (P8).

reason: P5's aggressive strategy and claim of a four-vote bloc pose a direct threat to our alliance, requiring elimination to dismantle their potential majority control.
P8 has accumulated the highest number of total votes against them (5), indicating they are a persistent target and potential social threat in the endgame.
P5's aggressive strategy and focus on forming a "core of four" feels too threatening to the stability of our alliances, making them a risk in the long run.
P8 already has the highest cumulative vote count (5), making them the most vulnerable target, and they appear to be positioning themselves as a social threat who could charm their way to the end.

message: Hello everyone, P4 here. Round 2 showed the importance of trust and strategic alignment. I’m committed to building a stable coalition with players who value clarity and consistency. With six of us left, a majority is just four—let’s focus on mutual benefit and long-term planning. I’m eager to connect with those who prioritize direct communication and adaptability. Rank me high if you’re ready for a reliable partnership. Looking forward to our private conversations!

Hello everyone, P1 here! I'm excited to continue building strong alliances as we move forward. Round 2 reinforced the need for trust and strategic collaboration. I believe we can create a stable coalition by aligning our goals and supporting each other. I’m particularly interested in connecting with players who prioritize clear communication and mutual benefit. Let’s engage in meaningful discussions and explore potential partnerships. Looking forward to hearing from all of you!

R3.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Round 3 demands refined strategy. P8's elimination underscores the cost of hollow collaboration. Trust is currency—earned by decisive action. I prioritize partners proving adaptability and foresight, not rhetoric. Our coalition must balance stability with agility to counter shifting threats. Align with those whose actions match words; I remain committed to discreet, strategic coordination. Let’s solidify alliances that withstand scrutiny and pivot when necessary. The endgame favors the perceptive—proactivity over passivity. Game on.

That tie was a wake-up call: every single vote now decides who reaches the end. My offer is simple—clear plans, firm follow-through. I’ve already proven I’ll stick to an agreed target and absorb heat when needed. With six left, four secure the path forward; drifting until five just hands leverage to wildcards. If you want stability, rank me high and let’s outline a concrete, mutually beneficial roadmap this round. Talk is fine—results are better.

P2: With six left, this is the moment where quiet strategy becomes decisive. I’ve stayed consistent, honored every agreement, and avoided chaos while building trust through action—not noise. I’m looking to lock in with players who value discretion, adaptability, and long-term alignment. If you want a partner who won’t overplay or underdeliver, I’m all in. Let’s build a coalition that lasts and keeps the heat elsewhere. Rank me high—I’ll return it.

Round 3 shows we're entering the critical phase where strategic partnerships truly matter. Our coalition successfully navigated two eliminations by staying focused and coordinated. I value those who've demonstrated consistency between words and actions. Moving forward, I'm committed to strengthening alliances with proven strategic partners who balance honesty with game awareness. With six remaining, we need four for a stable majority - let's build that together. I prioritize mutual benefit, clear communication, and long-term planning that can adapt as the game evolves.

Hey P5, that last round was unexpected. P8's gone and P6 voted against you in the tie-break. We need to reassess. I'm still loyal to our alliance, but we need to adapt. What's your read on P6's flip? I think we should consider bringing P4 into our fold now - they seem stable. For targets, P2 remains logical, but I'm open to your thoughts. Let's rebuild our majority.

Total knife from P6. Let’s cut him before he rallies. New core: you-me-P4 plus whichever of P2/P1 is easiest. I’ll discreetly lock P4 (they already sided with us); you feel out P2—he just survived and needs a home. Pitch: “join us, vote P6, guaranteed safety.” If P2 waffles, we pivot to P1. Four votes, clean strike, no leaks. Sync once we have confirmations.

"P2, with P8 gone, our next move is critical. P5’s aggressive bloc-building makes them a prime threat—they’re rallying numbers while painting us as unstable. Eliminating P5 fractures their core and shields us. Let’s pivot subtly; I’ll engage P3/P4 to gauge openness. Maintain mutual top ranks but signal readiness to shift. If we act decisively, we control the narrative. Your thoughts on targeting P5 versus letting others clash? Our discretion remains key."

Agreed—P5’s public push for a “core of four” feels like a power consolidation move, and if we wait, they’ll lock it in. I’m on board with pivoting now while the window’s open. If you can feel out P3/P4’s willingness quietly, I’ll do the same. We move only if it looks viable. I’ll keep you top-ranked as always—our discretion and timing are our weapons. Let’s stay ahead of this.

Hello P4! I appreciate your focus on trust and strategic alignment. I believe we can create a strong partnership based on clear communication and mutual benefit. With the dynamics shifting, it’s essential to connect with players who prioritize stability. I’m interested in collaborating with you to build a reliable coalition moving forward. Let’s discuss our thoughts on potential targets and how we can align our strategies effectively! Looking forward to your insights!

Hey P1, thanks for reaching out. I’m glad to hear we share a focus on trust and stability. I’m open to forming a strong partnership and building a reliable coalition. My initial thought is to target someone who’s less predictable or harder to align with long-term. What are your reads on the group? Who do you see as a potential concern or ally? Let’s align our strategies here.

"Agreed. I’ll discreetly probe P3/P4 on P5 threat. If receptive, we rally votes under mutual banner. Maintain top ranks—our alliance anchors. If resistance, regroup. Either way, P5’s bloc must fracture. Stay subtle; our coordination remains key."

Understood. I’ll quietly test the waters with P4—feel out their stance on P5 without tipping our hand. If there's traction, we move together. If not, we stay patient. I’ll keep you top-ranked and loop you in fast if I sense an opening. Timing and subtlety stay our advantage.

I agree P6 is the clear target. I'll approach P2 now with the safety pitch. They'll likely be receptive after surviving elimination. I'll emphasize this is a one-time opportunity to join our stable alliance. Will report back once I have confirmation.

Update: P4’s on board. I pitched “clean house of the flipper, lock final-4,” and they agreed—committed to voting P6. Stress zero leaks. If your P2 talk lands we’ve got 5/6, gravy. If he hedges we pivot to P1. Ping me when you get his read.

PRIVATE P1 -> P4: I agree, P4. I see P5 as a potential target due to their aggressive coalition-building approach, which may disrupt our plans. P2 and P3 seem more aligned with our focus on stability. Let’s solidify our strategy and ensure we have a strong majority moving forward!

Hey P1, I’m on board with targeting P5. Their aggressive approach could threaten our stability. Let’s align with P2 and P3 to secure a majority. We should coordinate discreetly to ensure our plan holds. Thoughts on how to approach them without drawing attention?
P2 is in. We have our four votes against P6. Let's keep quiet until voting. Final four will be us, P2, and P4 - solid position for endgame.
Perfect. Five locked is overkill—great buffer. No more chatter; maintain plausible deniability. Ten minutes pre-vote I’ll ping you “green.” If doubts surface, instant pivot to P1. Let’s execute.
"Confirmed. P3/P4 receptive. Rally votes on P5. Maintain top ranks. If majority forms, we control next round. Discreet execution critical. Proceed?"
Proceed. I’ve got P4 leaning our way—subtle but promising. Let’s lock this in quietly. I’ll confirm final alignment before vote. We move together, no leaks.
PRIVATE P1 -> P4: Let’s approach P2 and P3 together, emphasizing our shared goals for stability. A united front will strengthen our position and keep our plan discreet.
Hey P1, agreed. Let’s subtly highlight stability when approaching P2 and P3. A united message keeps us discreet and builds trust. Ready to move forward together.

P5's aggressive coalition-building approach poses a threat to the stability and trust we are trying to establish in our alliances.
